Copywriter at Coffee Meets Bagel

Remote

SF, SEATTLE, OR REMOTE

MARKETING

FULL-TIME

Coffee Meets Bagel’s mission is to inspire singles to share and connect authentically. The app curates quality matches with fuller profiles that result in real conversations. Globally, CMB has generated millions of real dates and thousands of lasting relationships. Coffee Meets Bagel was named one of the Top 10 Dating apps by Time Magazine and the Best Dating App for Women by Refinery29. It has also been voted the #1 recommended dating app for singles looking for relationships.

CMB is currently seeking to hire our very first in-house copywriter. This is a very flexible position that can be done part -time/contract or full- time, on-site or remotely. If you are a great candidate and want to work part time/contract, we are willing to reduce the scope of work to make that possible.

As the first copywriter to join CMB, you’ll drive the creative strategy and messaging for all of CMB’s product and marketing communications.

Our job is to enable our members to not just meet people, but to meet the right person for their life-stage and journey and fulfill on their larger desire to grow and take the next steps in life. The role will play a key role in making our brand story come alive via precise, sticky, and unique voice in all of our product and marketing efforts.

You’ll collaborate with marketing managers, product managers, designers, social media managers, PR strategist, and the founders, in a fast-paced, rapidly-growing environment to re-ignite enthusiasm towards dating for people around the world.

Responsibilities:

  • Write, edit, and proofread high-quality, on-brand copy for all channels: product, email, landing pages, in-app, push notifications, SMS messages, social media posts, collaterals for events.
  • Write and edit blog content based on briefs and/or interviews.
  • Collaborate with marketing team members to develop strategic solutions against marketing briefs. Question marketing briefs to push things forward.
  • Leverage research and insights to develop communications that meet our customers’ desires and needs.
  • Partner with cross-functional teams (product, marketing, customer experience) to execute projects.
  • A/B test copy across different channels.
  • Work through multiple review rounds efficiently, managing stakeholders, and working with designers to finish projects on time.
  • Manage your projects from start to finish; checking in with your creative lead to ensure copy meets expectations.
  • Be able to contribute creative ideas, take creative direction, and be flexible.
  • Present your work to creative leads and project stakeholders.
  • Pitch new ideas for marketing campaigns.

Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of experience as a copywriter for an advertising agency or in-house for a consumer brands that heavily uses digital channels.
  • An ability to adapt to a new tone of voice, helping to define and push it forward.
  • An ability to make complex product concept and marketing programs sound simple.
  • Organized, solid copy editor, excellent proofreader. Meticulous about spelling and punctuation, extreme attention to detail.
  • A good understanding of how design and copy work together.
  • Organization skills; you can effectively manage your time and prioritize your workload.
  • An ability to work in a fast paced environment, collaborating with a broad in-house team.
  • Experience conceiving campaign ideas, collaborating with design and brand teams.
  • A track record managing your own workload efficiently.
  • Familiarity with Google Docs and Slides.

Digital Content Manager

Anywhere in the US
Company: MeetEdgar

FULL-TIME

Overview

We want to grow our marketing team by adding an experienced Digital Content Manager with skills in both content strategy and storytelling. (We wanted to grow our marketing team by supplying Kalteen bars, but that only upset people, so now we’re trying this.)

About You

You are a masterful writer who loves to write and is inspired by a good deadline! This is a fast-paced, high-production job and you must have previous experience in that kind of environment. You’re comfortable with direct feedback and can make rapid changes when needed.

Your style is conversational and compelling. We don’t take ourselves too seriously, and we like our audience to have fun with the content that we create. You despise spammy, “content farm” style writing. You create engaging, smart writing that will stand out from the endless stream of mediocre blog posts and sales emails.

You have a results-oriented mindset. You’re guided by data and you’re interested in writing that produces measurable results. You enjoy circling back through what you’ve created to gauge its effectiveness, and you geek out on making changes or performing tests to optimize those results. You can view your work objectively to recognize what is and isn’t working, then course correct as needed.

You know our audience intimately – in fact, you love reading the same type of content they do. You get excited about topics like social media management, online marketing (especially for small businesses), and business productivity. You know how to turn a piece about a Facebook algorithm change into something that’s actually entertaining and compelling to read, without sacrificing usefulness for style. You love a great tech tool and you’re always on the hunt for what’s new and interesting in our industry.

About the Job

You will help direct the voice of all of our content, from banner ads to long-form educational content and well-researched blog posts on the latest social media trends. (That also means working interdepartmentally, collaborating with other departments to ensure that all the content we share adheres to our brand voice guidelines.)You’ll work on our Marketing team to strategize and execute a variety of direct response sales materials, including email funnels and opt-in pages. Day in and day out, you’ll be responsible for making sure we’re creating and sharing great stuff.

This is an extremely self-directed role. You’ll be working as part of a team, but your assignments will belong to you from start to finish – this means you’ll be handling things like brainstorming and researching topics, writing and editing, formatting and publishing your work on our blog/website, and reporting back to the rest of the team on our content’s performance.

This is both a creative and a tactical position – you’ll dream up ways to get our audience excited, and execute them.

Your duties will include:

– Strategizing and writing marketing copy for products and promotions, including landing pages and email sequences
– Writing high quality blog posts from scratch on a variety of marketing and small business topics in our established brand voice and tone
– Writing social media status updates to promote your work
– Reporting on the performance of your own content and looking for ways to optimize your work to achieve performance and conversion goals
– Conduct keyword research to plan content that will increase inbound site traffic
– Tracking and optimizing content for target keywords for SEO
– Uploading, formatting, scheduling, and publishing your own blog posts (we use WordPress!)
– Generally creating, finding, and editing fun, useful, awesome content to represent our brand online
– Work with our current copywriter to create strategic email marketing campaigns that help us reach our company goals (more customers!)

In other words? You’ll have a major hand in growing our business and reaching thousands of small-business customers, with a significant sense of independence and ownership to go with it.

As we keep on growing, you’ll find plenty of new opportunities to help us take our marketing to the next level!

Job Deets Cheat Sheet

Your experience:

– 3+ years of full-time professional writing (not for school or occasional blogging for fun)
– Success in working in a semi-autonomous role, must be a self-starter
– Managed or represented a brand on social media – our audience consists of small businesses and entrepreneurs who look to us as a resource for their social media marketing. You must be a subject matter expert that can write credibly about the happenings in the social media world!
– Editing and reviewing other people’s content

Minimum technical skills:

– WordPress
– Social media management tools
– Mailchimp or similar ESP

Extra special bonus points for any of the following:

– You are a MeetEdgar user

About Us

We’re a small team of 25-some people, all working remotely across the US & Canada. We do a lot of collaborating and meme-swapping on Slack, along with virtual team meetings and super-futuristic video calls. We also do a twice-annual retreat week where we work together on cool projects all day and rock the karaoke mic all night. (Spoiler alert: This means you have to be willing and able to travel to those retreats! The karaoke, however, is optional.)We’re proudly bootstrapped and profitable, which means we get to turn down VC money a lot and keep doing things the way we like. We’re pretty serious about building and maintaining an awesome, positive company culture, so, you know, no jerks.

We’ll probably get along if you’re someone who wants to be creative, have a pretty-serious-but-not-inhuman amount of responsibility, and work with people who make going to work not suck. (And be one of those people yourself. We like those people.)

And on that note, we’re proud to be an equal-opportunity employer genuinely committed to building a diverse team, and to fostering the type of inclusive environment in which diversity thrives.

Want to learn more? You can:
Check out our employee handbook:
Preview what happens your first day on the job:
Go in-depth on the perks & benefits:

You can also learn more at

Perks & Benefits

– Work from home (or wherever there’s strong wifi)
– 4 weeks paid vacation (Shazam! And yes, everyone actually uses all 4 weeks)
– Up to two months family leave for new parents (including adoption!)
– Monthly cleaning service for your home – not that we don’t have total faith in you
– Paid home Internet service
– Coworking space/coffee shop working expenses
– Health, dental, and vision coverage for you and your fam
– 401(k) plan with employer match
– An extra paid day off per quarter so you can volunteer in your community (awww)
– New Mac laptop that you get to keep after 6 months (#blessed)
– Books, conferences, and other educational resources to help you be even more amazing at what you do!
– TSA pre-check to make getting to retreats and conferences a breezeCheck ‘em out in even more detail here (you know you’re curious):

Freelance Writer to Simplify Legalese


Legalcom

 verified
We're looking for reliable, talented freelance writers who love writing about a wide range of topics, including legal topics.

Most of our work is on legal topics. All topics related to legal are entry-level and not at an academic level.

You'll be writing about everything from why a certain legal contract is required for a business to writing a checklist article of best tools to use for an e-commerce store to increase sales.

**About The Work**

We understand the value of quality content. We're not looking for plain text articles, but well-researched articles to educate our customers: articles with images, links, quotes from research papers, expert's quotes etc.

Our articles are often 1000+ words, generally around 2,000 words. Some articles are beyond 10,000 words.

We're not looking to game search engines, but rather educate our customers about the legal contracts they're searching for. We aim to be a teacher to our customers.

We are looking for writers available for a minimum of one day/week. We have as much work as you can handle. We don't micromanage.

We are very clear on what we want for every article. We provide topics with a proposed structure including due dates and the minimum required length. There is sometimes communication back and forth during the revision session. But for the most part: you write the article, turn it in, we review and ask for edits if necessary and then publish it.

Writers get paid every other week, in US dollars by PayPal.

Depending on where we'll publish your work, and for as much as we can, we'll show your bio byline to give you author credits.

Responsibilities

* Native English speaker with strong writing skills. We can make an exception on this if you have English Proficiency qualification.* Exceptional online research skills* Well organized and reliable* Some degree of technical proficiency (using Google Docs, taking screenshots)It’s a major plus if you have any of the following:* Legal degree or paralegal experience

Requirements

items.title: Growth Copywriter
items.content:
Growth Copywriter

Company: Ladder

We are looking for an ambitious, experienced copywriter who has the potential and determination to become a world-class expert in writing content to help grow companies.

  • Must have a portfolio of previous work to showcase your ability, accessible online
  • At least 2 years’ experience in a copywriting role at a fast-growing company.
  • Capacity for critical thinking and employing strategy to hit business goals.
  • Expected to flex your creative muscles and take full responsibility for performance.
  • Interested in mastering all aspects of copywriting (ads, website, blogs, emails).
  • Certifications via online or in-person digital marketing courses are a plus.

Growth Copywriter Role

You’ll work directly with the strategy team to plug in remotely as a copywriter at Ladder for our clients. You will own any copywriting briefs that get assigned to you, defining the strategy and handling execution, taking advice from the team and escalating issues to the Account Director as needed. Because your work will be reviewed directly by founders and senior managers at startups and large enterprises, the work environment is demanding and fast-paced.

To support your continuing development, we have an in-depth training plan based on our blog content and online courses we have subscriptions to. Our in-house software helps make your client briefs easier to manage, and it has hundreds of growth tactics to help you generate ideas from what's worked before for similar clients. Along the way, you will be expected to communicate progress clearly and confidently to the rest of the Ladder team. You will also be involved in training and recruiting new hires.

Future Development

You will start on smaller clients initially, increasingly working on more strategic clients as you get comfortable with our process and show your ability to produce high quality work. After your first year you will be eligible for promotion to the Senior Growth Copywriter role, which comes with a pay rise and additional supervisory / training responsibilities. 18 months in, our goal is for you to be a notable rising star within the copywriting community. As well as the training program and support from the team, Ladder’s leadership team will be actively coaching you and helping you carve out your own role as the company expands.

Team Culture

You will be based remotely, but can work from our New York City, London or Wroclaw offices when desired for this role. Dress code is informal (jeans and t-shirts are fine) but professional if you're in the office, as we often have clients visiting. We encourage remote employees to visit one of our offices each quarter and will pay for your travel within reason.

We will often pay for team lunches on special occasions / dinner if we’re working late. We host regular happy hours, game nights and other team events. Our meme game is strong and we all have custom slack emojis / obscure nicknames. We have a strong culture of supporting each other with client or strategy issues, and bouncing ideas back and forth.

If you’re a hard worker and are genuinely interested in finding innovative ways to help companies grow, you’ll love it here!
How to apply:

The reins: an opportunity as Creative Director / Editor-in-Chief at exciting young production company

Company: Course Concierge LLC

10 July 2018

The reins: an opportunity as Creative Director / Editor-in-Chief at exciting young production company

Hi there,

My name’s Edward. I work with entrepreneur and speaker Till H. Gross, and together we run Course Concierge. We’re an online course publishing house that develops courses for NYT best-selling authors, TED speakers, social media authorities and those with something to say.

Our clients include YouTubers with 150,000,000 views, one of the most hotly-followed health experts on Instagram, and a coach to NFL athletes, NBA players and U.S. special forces.

Check us out here: http://courseconcierge.com

For the right person, this is a Dream Opportunity — and dream company.

We’re a year-and-a-half-old and growing, and looking for someone for a role that fuses Creative Director and Editor-in-Chief; someone who can oversee and orchestrate our productions – design, development, marketing, editorial and film.

Online courses, for the most part, have a lethargic reputation. Compared with today’s video games, things are still in the primitive stages; about as far evolved as Pong. But online courses’ possibilities are endless, and that’s something we’ve set to override. A book is a book. An online course is, well, anything you want it to be. There’s a promise of the internet that’s yet to be delivered, and we’d like to be its bearer.

Each production is a serious operation, and we have many going on at the same time. There’s a picture of U.S. chess champion Bobby Fischer at age 21 playing 50 games of chess simultaneously. We need someone who can match that in productions, on topics as varied as autism enterprises to cybersecurity to yoga, and each with its own multiple five-figure budget. You’d be overseeing productions at large, tasked with driving them forward with the team harmoniously.

Directing has a great reverence in film-making. We’d like someone who can help bring about the same in online education.

We’re a company that has our house in order, and we’ve structured things very deliberately. We have a system.

And our early works have been supremely effective – we know how to drive action. The below is just one week following the release of “The Weekend Woodworker”, a course we helped produce with Steve Ramsey:

https://www.instagram.com/p/BbKigoaH1VU/?taken-by=steveramsey_wwmm

One heuristic for a course for strength coaches: “I’d happily have this person train my mum & dad after taking this”. Another all-purpose: “Would I be comfortable selling this to my best friend?” (We need courses for which the answer is a resounding Yes!)

You need to have a definite interest in online learning, curriculum development and the future of education – and relish the prospect of crafting the best learning experience imaginable.

Our ideal candidate...

- Is a strong leader. You can put pressure on the team to produce courses on time and know what a great product looks like.

- Considers themselves a coach. We want someone who can get the very best out of everyone on the team – a nurturer.

- Has a philosophy of learning. Our clients often want workbooks and quizzes. But how to do them in non-boring way? We want someone for whom, pent up from all the things you think wrong with the school educational system, wants to put things right with free rein to rewrite the rules. The opportunity to shake things up excites you.

- Can be both a “maker” (rolling up your sleeves to do things) and a manager – able to switch between the two effortlessly.

- Can guide smooth handoffs between team members, and push responsibility widely throughout the team while keeping a close eye to things.

- Can hold their own with some seriously accomplished clientele. You’re ultimately culpable for the success and client experience of productions, and a client should be able to get you on the phone promptly (in the rare circumstance) they’re dissatisfied with something.

- Is willing and able to recruit other course editors, continuing to build our brilliant team as we grow.

- Is interested on all things on the horizon – AR, VR and other cutting-edge technologies and how we might utilise them.

- Can work with clients to ensure they get what they want, yet knows how to say “no” when necessary.

We’re a great company to join. Here’s why…

- The company is still young (just 18 months) and you will be getting in at the ground level. This will be one of our most important positions, and crucial to making sure our next steps are the right ones.

- Despite the company being young, we’ve a combined experience of several decades in publishing and online course creation. We have an unbelievably engaged team, with world-class people in every department, from video production to design to development to copywriting and editorial.

- We’ve got our ducks in a row. We have solid processes across the company (most strongly in production) and battle-proven workflows. The foundation is already there, so it’s yours to focus on building what we have.

- Our clients are fantastic. We have the good fortune to be incredibly selective in who we work with, and a great many have a great sense of mission in what they do.

- We’re a remote company and you’ve the freedom to work from anywhere. Preferably we’re looking for someone in North America, but are open to candidates the world over. (Our current team spans 13 time zones.)

- We’re going places.

*

This isn’t to be a typical job search. We expect to spend up to six months looking to find the right person.

There’s no deadline to reply, but please get in touch if you think you could be a good fit.

Pay will be set at a competitive rate, and we’re happy to work with notice periods, transitioning to having you come on full-time when ready.

Please do not send a CV – we don’t care where, or even whether, you went to school –  but do note experience that would allow you to command the position.

For those who stand out, we will be in touch to discuss next steps.

Thank you for considering the position. I look forward to hearing from you,

Edward

  • Expected to flex your creative muscles and take full responsibility for performance.

Growth Copywriter Role

You’ll work directly with the strategy team to plug in remotely as a copywriter at Ladder for our clients. You will own any copywriting briefs that get assigned to you, defining the strategy and handling execution, taking advice from the team and escalating issues to the Account Director as needed. Because your work will be reviewed directly by founders and senior managers at startups and large enterprises, the work environment is demanding and fast-paced.

To support your continuing development, we have an in-depth training plan based on our blog content and online courses we have subscriptions to. Our in-house software helps make your client briefs easier to manage, and it has hundreds of growth tactics to help you generate ideas from what's worked before for similar clients. Along the way, you will be expected to communicate progress clearly and confidently to the rest of the Ladder team. You will also be involved in training and recruiting new hires.

You will start on smaller clients initially, increasingly working on more strategic clients as you get comfortable with our process and show your ability to produce high quality work. After your first year you will be eligible for promotion to the Senior Growth Copywriter role, which comes with a pay rise and additional supervisory / training responsibilities. 18 months in, our goal is for you to be a notable rising star within the copywriting community. You will be based remotely, but can work from our New York City, London or Wroclaw offices when desired for this role. Dress code is informal (jeans and t-shirts are fine) but professional if you're in the office, as we often have clients visiting. We encourage remote employees to visit one of our offices each quarter and will pay for your travel within reason.

We will often pay for team lunches on special occasions / dinner if we’re working late. We host regular happy hours, game nights and other team events. Our meme game is strong and we all have custom slack emojis / obscure nicknames. We have a strong culture of supporting each other with client or strategy issues, and bouncing ideas back and forth.

If you’re a hard worker and are genuinely interested in finding innovative ways to help companies grow, you’ll love it here!

The reins: an opportunity as Creative Director / Editor-in-Chief at exciting young production company

Company: Course Concierge LLC
Headquarters: Los Angeles, LA

10 July 2018

The reins: an opportunity as Creative Director / Editor-in-Chief at exciting young production company

Hi there,

My name’s Edward. I work with entrepreneur and speaker Till H. Gross, and together we run Course Concierge. We’re an online course publishing house that develops courses for NYT best-selling authors, TED speakers, social media authorities and those with something to say.

Our clients include YouTubers with 150,000,000 views, one of the most hotly-followed health experts on Instagram, and a coach to NFL athletes, NBA players and U.S. special forces.

Check us out here: http://courseconcierge.com

For the right person, this is a Dream Opportunity — and dream company.

We’re a year-and-a-half-old and growing, and looking for someone for a role that fuses Creative Director and Editor-in-Chief; someone who can oversee and orchestrate our productions – design, development, marketing, editorial and film.

Online courses, for the most part, have a lethargic reputation. Compared with today’s video games, things are still in the primitive stages; about as far evolved as Pong. But online courses’ possibilities are endless, and that’s something we’ve set to override. A book is a book. An online course is, well, anything you want it to be. There’s a promise of the internet that’s yet to be delivered, and we’d like to be its bearer.

Each production is a serious operation, and we have many going on at the same time. There’s a picture of U.S. chess champion Bobby Fischer at age 21 playing 50 games of chess simultaneously. We need someone who can match that in productions, on topics as varied as autism enterprises to cybersecurity to yoga, and each with its own multiple five-figure budget. You’d be overseeing productions at large, tasked with driving them forward with the team harmoniously.

Directing has a great reverence in film-making. We’d like someone who can help bring about the same in online education.

We’re a company that has our house in order, and we’ve structured things very deliberately. We have a system.

And our early works have been supremely effective – we know how to drive action. The below is just one week following the release of “The Weekend Woodworker”, a course we helped produce with Steve Ramsey:

https://www.instagram.com/p/BbKigoaH1VU/?taken-by=steveramsey_wwmm

One heuristic for a course for strength coaches: “I’d happily have this person train my mum & dad after taking this”. Another all-purpose: “Would I be comfortable selling this to my best friend?” (We need courses for which the answer is a resounding Yes!)

You need to have a definite interest in online learning, curriculum development and the future of education – and relish the prospect of crafting the best learning experience imaginable.

Our ideal candidate...

- Is a strong leader. You can put pressure on the team to produce courses on time and know what a great product looks like.

- Considers themselves a coach. We want someone who can get the very best out of everyone on the team – a nurturer.

- Has a philosophy of learning. Our clients often want workbooks and quizzes. But how to do them in non-boring way? We want someone for whom, pent up from all the things you think wrong with the school educational system, wants to put things right with free rein to rewrite the rules. The opportunity to shake things up excites you.

- Can be both a “maker” (rolling up your sleeves to do things) and a manager – able to switch between the two effortlessly.

- Can guide smooth handoffs between team members, and push responsibility widely throughout the team while keeping a close eye to things.

- Can hold their own with some seriously accomplished clientele. You’re ultimately culpable for the success and client experience of productions, and a client should be able to get you on the phone promptly (in the rare circumstance) they’re dissatisfied with something.

- Is willing and able to recruit other course editors, continuing to build our brilliant team as we grow.

- Is interested on all things on the horizon – AR, VR and other cutting edge technologies and how we might utilise them.

- Can work with clients to ensure they get what they want, yet knows how to say “no” when necessary.

We’re a great company to join. Here’s why…

- The company is still young (just 18 months) and you will be getting in at the ground level. This will be one of our most important positions, and crucial to making sure our next steps are the right ones.

- Despite the company being young, we’ve a combined experience of several decades in publishing and online course creation. We have an unbelievably engaged team, with world-class people in every department, from video production to design to development to copywriting and editorial.

- We’ve got our ducks in a row. We have solid processes across the company (most strongly in production) and battle-proven workflows. The foundation is already there, so it’s yours to focus on building what we have.

- Our clients are fantastic. We have the good fortune to be incredibly selective in who we work with, and a great many have a great sense of mission in what they do.

- We’re a remote company and you’ve the freedom to work from anywhere. Preferably we’re looking for someone in North America, but are open to candidates the world over. (Our current team spans 13 time zones.)

- We’re going places.

*

This isn’t to be a typical job search. We expect to spend up to six months looking to find the right person.

There’s no deadline to reply, but please get in touch if you think you could be a good fit.

Pay will be set at a competitive rate, and we’re happy to work with notice periods, transitioning to having you come on full-time when ready.

Please do not send a CV – we don’t care where, or even whether, you went to school –  but do note experience that would allow you to command the position.

For those who stand out, we will be in touch to discuss next steps.

Thank you for considering the position. I look forward to hearing from you,

Edward

Job description

As a Technical Documentation Writer, you will work closely with our global team to create and maintain content that enables our users to do amazing things with Radix. You will work with product managers, developers, quality engineers, developer advocates, technical support, and marketing to create content that not only provides useful information but also serves to enhance the overall user experience.

Your main responsibilities are:

  • Interview project team members, subject matter experts, customers, and product support to determine required technical and user information.

You will be responsible for creating appropriate content in the form of concepts and architecture guides, developer guides, code samples, language references, API references, and other online material such as training videos.

  • Create graphics and diagrams that help novice and expert users understand complex technical concepts.

  • Opinions on what technologies and standards we should use now and in the future, we always want to hear new ideas.

  • Knowledge of git, branching, continuous integration and modern development pipelines.

Background: Mercy Corps is a leading global organization that works in 40 countries around the world to alleviate suffering, poverty and oppression by helping people build secure, productive and just communities. Since 2012, Mercy Corps has worked to tackle Nigeria’s complex and evolving needs through a range of dynamic, multi-sector programs. In Northeast Nigeria, Mercy Corps is addressing the immediate humanitarian needs of vulnerable communities; enabling conflict-affected populations to transform from relief to resilience using market-driven approaches; and supporting community-led peace building efforts.

Purpose / Project Description: As the impact of on-going hostilities has diminished in many areas of the Northeast, there is a window of opportunity to communicate to would-be defectors of Non- State Armed Groups (NSAG) complicit in the conflict that there are avenues to safely and peacefully reintegrate into communities. Equally as important is disseminating messaging around de-radicalization, rehabilitation and reintegration (DRR) programs to host communities to promote the acceptance of amnestied returning ex-combatants. Radio is king in the Lake Chad Basin region, an area comprising roughly 1.5 million square kilometers (approximately one third the size of the United States). High illiteracy rates, lack of infrastructure, extreme levels of poverty and an absence of mass communication technology that can reach target audiences in their native language, makes the development and use of radio to disseminate accurate and consistent information critical. Mercy Corps, through funding from the United States Department of State, is currently implementing the Using the Airwaves for Stability in the Lake Chad Basin (UAS LCB) Program. The program seeks to produce and air news, current affairs and special content programming on radio station(s) operating in the Lake Chad Basin to increase understanding of, and support for, the de-radicalization, rehabilitation and reintegration of ex-combatants. This program will result in reduced support for violence, and greater openness to reintegrating returning ex-combatants into communities.

Consultant Objectives: Mercy Corps Nigeria is seeking a radio content developer to develop context-specific DRR content for radio broadcasts over a 5-month period from August 2018 through December 2018 (with the potential for a 1-year extension through 2019). Mercy Corps is currently collaborating with researchers from UCLA and Yale University to conduct a study on the most effective types of messaging used in DRR radio programming, and the results of this study will help inform the content to be developed. In order to have the greatest impact, radio content in both Hausa and Kanuri language will be required.

Consultant Activities: The Consultant will develop radio content in Hausa and Kanuri to:

  • Inform listeners of the existence of DRR strategies through regular news, current affairs and special programing content, including interviews with Nigerian policymakers, government officials, religious and community leaders
  • Profile the experiences of ex-combatants from non-state armed groups who have successfully left the on-going conflict, will include in-depth interviews
  • Provide debate and discussion programs to allow community members to express their views and experiences with conflict and violence, as well as their thoughts on the DRR process
  • Encourage discussion on the drivers of conflict in the Lake Chad Basin, including poor governance, identity-based marginalization, and weak rule of law on radio news, current affairs and special content programs
  • Create an alternative narrative using Kanuri history and culture that delegitimizes non-state armed group messaging around alignment of values, will include Kanuri text readings and interviews with Kanuri community leaders

Consultant Deliverables: The Consultant will:

  • Develop a radio broadcast strategy and calendar detailing the radio content to be broadcast over a 5-month period from August through December 2018 (with the potential for a 1-year extension)
  • Create storyboards and synopses for the to-be-developed radio content for Mercy Corps’ review and approval. Revise storyboards to incorporate Mercy Corps’ feedback.
  • Based on the storyboards and synopses:
    • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri to inform listeners of the existence of DRR strategies, including through 90 interviews with Nigerian policymakers, government officials, religious and community leaders
    • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri that profiles the experiences of ex-combatants who have successfully left the ongoing conflict, includes at least 12 in-depth interviews
    • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri to encourage discussion on the drivers of conflict in the Lake Chad Basin, including weak rule of law, poor governance, and identity-based marginalization, including through at least 96 in-depth interviews with academics and experts
    • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri to create an alternative narrative using Kanuri history and culture that delegitimizes non-state armed group messaging though alignment of values, includes through at least 8 Kanuri text readings and 6 interviews with Kanuri community leaders
  • The created radio content must be in a format that allows for radio station(s) around Nigeria and the Lake Chad Basin to broadcast the content.

Timeframe / Schedule:

  • Radio broadcast strategy and calendar detailing the radio content to be broadcast over a 5-month period from August through December (with the potential for a 1-year extension) Due date: July 20, 2018
  • Storyboards and synopses for to-be-developed radio content for Mercy Corps’ review and approval. Revise storyboards to incorporate Mercy Corps’ feedback. Due date: Initial storyboards and synopses must be provided prior to the first broadcasts, with subsequent storyboards and synopses provided on an ongoing basis through December 2018.
  • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri to inform listeners of the existence of DRR strategies, including through 90 interviews with Nigerian policymakers, government officials, religious and community leaders Due date: First broadcast in August 2018 and continuing through December 2018
  • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri that profiles the experiences of ex-combatants who have successfully left the ongoing conflict, at least 12 in-depth interviews Due date: First broadcast in August 2018 and continuing through December 2018
  • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri to encourage discussion on the drivers of conflict in the Lake Chad Basin, at least 96 in-depth interviews with academics and experts Due date: First broadcast in August 2018 and continuing through December 2018
  • Create radio content in Hausa and Kanuri to create an alternative narrative using Kanuri history and culture that delegitimizes non-state armed group messaging around alignment of values, at least 8 Kanuri text readings and 6 interviews with Kanuri community leaders Due date: First broadcast in August 2018 and continuing through December 2018

Consultant Profile:

  • Highly experienced with 5+ years of content and radio production experience.
  • Excellent writer, storyteller and communicator with extensive experience editing and mixing audio. Documentary or journalism experience is a plus.
  • Experience of living and working overseas is desirable, along with experience of producing editorial content for non-US audiences.
  • Knowledge / experience in community peace building and de-radicalization, rehabilitation and reintegration. Experience working for international NGOs or in civil society is a plus.
  • Knowledge of the issues affecting the Lake Chad Basin.
  • Ability to meet deadlines while working under pressure with tight deadlines.
  • Ability to create or translate content into Hausa and Kanuri.
  • Bachelor’s degree in broadcasting, communications, business or related field.

The Consultant will report to: North East Conflict Programs Manager

The Consultant will work closely with: TSU, Program Desk Officers, UAS-LCB Senior Program Officer

If you ask Deloitte Fast 50 or Santander Breakthrough50, they’d say we’re one of Britain’s most exciting and disruptive businesses. If you ask our team, they’d say we’re a no-politics, people-first company where exceptionally smart individuals get the chance to have their voice heard and potential fulfilled (then pushed that extra bit more).
And if you ask our clients, they’d say we’re the content production partner they rely on to rapidly create high-quality editorial, video and images to drive online sales. To date, we’ve produced over 40 million words of on-brand content – in 29 languages and counting – for 170+ of the world’s most prestigious brands, including eBay, Farfetch and Google.

We do that through a combination of our unique methodology, our global network of ~2500 screened freelance creatives and Quill Cloud, our content production management tool.

What does being a Community Manager at Quill involve?
In this brand new position, you’ll take a leading role in managing and engaging our global Network of 2,500+ creative and editorial freelancers. You’ll take ownership of innovating and implementing exciting Network-wide programmes, designed to make Quill the company freelancers want to work with. You’ll be responsible for proactively solving Network-focused problems, from individual issues to process flaws, and will set the standard for excellence in communication, both on a one-to-one basis when responding to queries and to the entire Network when launching new initiatives for them to take part in.

These are the skills you’ll need for the job:
Change management skills: can plan and execute the successful implementation of large-scale changes that affect both in-house and remote teams

Leadership: can motivate in-house and freelance colleagues to support on and participate in Network-focused initiatives

Business nous and strategic thinking: can balance understanding of the needs of different elements of the business and develop and execute engagement strategies in line with these needs

Analytic ability and enthusiasm for problem solving: can proactively and consistently analyse ways of working and embrace the opportunity to continually make things better

Empathy paired with pragmatism: can instinctively empathise with others and balance the drive to help with a pragmatic assessment of the circumstances and the needs of all of your stakeholders

Excellent one-to-one communication skills: can take active steps to understand the root of queries or issues and select the appropriate format for their expertly crafted comms – whether one-to-one or at a group level

And here’s the experience you need:
You must have experience of developing an idea from initial concept to successful roll-out, including planning the project, getting buy-in from key stakeholders and managing the implementation process and the associated communications

You must have experience of managing a large team or community, ideally with a number of remote individuals, and motivating them to deliver excellent results

You must have a wealth of experience in handling tricky and sensitive communications – both one-to-one, and at a higher level

Why should I join Quill?
Like most startups, we talk a lot about our culture. But for us, culture isn’t just words on a wall. It’s part of our recruitment process, our personal development plans and our day-to-day.

If any of this sounds like you, you’re looking for a spot on the right team:
Your integrity isn’t for sale. You’re a what you see is what you get type of person who’s honest about their strengths and development areas.

You don’t settle for second best. It really, really matters to you that everything you do is excellent. And you don’t shy away from empowering your colleagues to share those standards.

10 minutes with nothing to do feels like an hour for you. You’re smart, energetic and driven, so you’re at your best when everything’s a little hectic.

You don’t like going through the motions or blindly following instructions. You leap into complex situations that don’t have an easy answer and relish the challenge of coming up with one.

The idea of a fixed ‘remit’ doesn’t appeal to you. Neither does waiting three years to get a promotion you earned two years ago. You think and act beyond your role.

You’re a fundamentally kind, respectful person, searching for a place filled with similarly kind, respectful people.

What are the benefits?
On top of joining the Quill family and all the benefits that come with that, you’ll also get:
25 holiday days per year plus UK bank holidays
A contributory pension
Our Summer Away Day (no stuffy meeting rooms in sight)
Monthly socials and lunches/breakfasts
Fortnightly Inspire Lunches – past lunches have included how the CEO manages his wellbeing, what today’s most disruptive businesses have in common and a crash course in Russian
A significant amount of time, expertise and attention put into your personal development, plus an unusually broad scope for rapid career progression

Quill is an equal opportunities employer.

Discern Analytics 2.0 (DA2).

DA2 is a newer Cerner's product, similar to SAP BusinessObjects and built on the Eclipse Platform. With DA2 you can design, view and schedule reports. There is a semantic layer to define subject areas (domains), dimensions and measures. It is no SAP BusinessObjects, but I found it really powerful, flexible and feature rich. Strangely enough I do not really know anyone using DA2.

Like PowerInsight, it is a handy tool to pinpoint location of data in Cerner Millennium database - DA2 comes with ready to use domains and a set of dimensions and measures. You can simply drop them to a new document and generate actual database query. Last time I checked though, DA2 had only a few subject domains and Revenue Cycle domain was the most complete one.
